meanings.definition: A person who is impudent or cheeky.
meanings.sent1: The little boy at the park was a real saucebox, always teasing the other kids.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to talk to the saucebox student about their disruptive behavior in class.
meanings.sent3: The saucebox cat kept knocking things off the table just to get attention.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother was such a saucebox, always making sarcastic remarks.
meanings.sent5: The saucebox's witty remarks often made everyone laugh.

meanings.sent1: Please pass me the saucebox so I can pour some ketchup on my fries.
meanings.sent2: The chef reached for the saucebox to add a drizzle of dressing to the salad.
meanings.sent3: The saucebox on the table was filled with different condiments for the guests.
meanings.sent4: She grabbed the saucebox and carefully poured the barbecue sauce over the grilled chicken.
meanings.sent5: The shiny saucebox gleamed under the kitchen lights.
